@Uncalled wrote:

his only “point” was the market share.

item.title: Virus blackout on monday
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Going back to this point:

[quote=“t4, post:7, topic:448839”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=551732.msg4042507#msg4042507 date=1341779808]

sorry i don’t use insecure operating systems that allow users to change system settings such as /etc/hosts

It’s just as easy to change dns on linux as it is on windows, so stfu

sure, but you have to be root

yeah, and you have to open the hosts file on windows as administrator, which requires elevated privileges to be allowed before you can do(unless you set your system like a retard)
[/quote]
around half of microsoft’s market share is still windows XP, what you said is true in windows 7 assuming UAC isn’t disabled, however your point is not valid in XP.

usage share:

en.wikipedia.org

Microsoft Windows

Microsoft Windows is a group of several graphical operating system families, all of which are developed, marketed, and sold by Microsoft. Each family caters to a certain sector of the computing industry. Active Windows families include Windows NT and Windows Embedded; these may encompass subfamilies, e.g. Windows Embedded Compact (Windows CE) or Windows Server. Defunct Windows families include Windows 9x, Windows Mobile and Windows Phone. Microsoft introduced an operating environment named Window...

Did you look at the entire table you posted? 'Cause I didn’t, only source says XP still has largest market share, the other 2 display otherwise.

Read full topic

item.title: Virus blackout on monday
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

eczema3:

Doesn’t deter from the fact that in current versions of windows its just as difficult/easy to change the hosts files as it is in most linux distributions.

and we’ve come full circle

Read full topic

item.title: Virus blackout on monday
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Lol at setting up temporary dns servers to avoid the problem

If someone is using the rogue dns the fbi set up, can’t they just direct all users to a page with instructions to fix it?

Read full topic

item.title: Virus blackout on monday
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:9, topic:448839”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=551732.msg4042531#msg4042531 date=1341780634]
But how much of that is business/educational? It’s not Microsofts/FBI fault for a user running an now unsupported system.
[/quote]
Quite a lot of businesses and educational facilities still use XP. The whole argument of who’s fault it is is irrelevant and doesn’t really make much sense…

Also:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Windows_XP#Support_lifecycle:

On April 8, 2014, all support for Windows XP, including security updates and hotfixes, will be terminated.

Unsupported my ass?[/quote]
Doesn’t deter from the fact that in current versions of windows its just as difficult/easy to change the hosts files as it is in most linux distributions.

Read full topic
